result.execSummary:
The defendant Levi Allen Christian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100+ costs = $579, Cash bond to be applied; Mr. Christian will pay balance today.
The Court determines that Mr. Christian has already provided a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Levi Allen Christian

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 10:03am [mo]
Defendant Levi Allen Christian in court.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ; removes the drivers license suspension recommendation from CCS

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100+ costs = $579, Cash bond to be applied; Mr. Christian will pay balance today.
The Court determines that Mr. Christian has already provided a DNA sample.
recess: 10:20am
Status conference at 05-10-2016 10:00 am
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 10:01am [mo]
[Scheduled for Plea/Sentencing]
Defendant Levi Allen Christian in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court gives Mr. Christian his right to counsel
--Mr. Christian indicates that he would like to retain counsel

The Court directs Mr. Christian to first go to the SPD office; if unable to be represented by SPD Mr. Christian is to promptly file a Petition for Court Appointed counsel with the Court.
recess: 10:08am

NEXT: Status Conference on 5/10/16 at 10:00am
Proposed - Judgment of Bail Bond Forfeiture

Case called at 3:54pm [mo]
Defendant Levi Allen Christian not in court.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews Court Record
The Court finds the $300 bond that was posted 9/9/2015 is forfeit.
The $500 bond remains in place.
recess: 3:55pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-22-2016 10:00 am

Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing at 01-11-2016 03:45 pm
AMENDED

Case called at 10:10am [mo]
[Hearing on Failure to Appear]
Defendant Levi Allen Christian in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ gives case synopsis.
The Court and DA Happ clarify the bond posted by Mr. Christian, re: signatures by witness, surety and defendant. 
DA Happ proposes the administration of an amended bond, so that the conditions can be explained to Mr. Christian
The Court directs the Clerk to prepare an amended bond with the notation that on 11/21/15, the Defendant, Surety and Deputy were all present and the terms and conditions of the bond were discussed.
The Court, Counsel and Defendant discuss future scheduling. 
The Court holds this case in abeyance until 12/15/15, the State is to contact the Court by this date to schedule a hearing.
recess: 10:26am 

NEXT: State to contact the Court by 12/15/15 to schedule next hearing.
Court's response to Clerk's Note regarding bond
Clerk's Note regarding bond - Witness to Defendant's signture did not sign the bond
Bond Payment Information
Bond signed by the defendant but does not have a witness signature (Witness of Defendant's signature)
Bond Payment Information
Surety Information
Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD with 2 bonds; one bond signed by the defendant, one bond signed by the surety and a note from Dispatch
Bond received from JCSD (with surety signature only)
Notice of hearing Bail bond forfeiture hearing 1/12/16 at 1:00 pm
Shall Mr. Christian be taken into custody he may post $500 cash bond, so long as new hearing date is given.

Case called at 11:13am [mo]
Defendant Levi Allen Christian does NOT appear in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

The Court reviews the Court Record.
ADA Shock indicates that Mr. Christian did appear at the Pretrial Conference.
The Court issues a bench warrant, shall Mr. Christian be taken into custody he may post $500 cash bond, so long as new hearing date is given. 
On Motion of the State, the finds bond is in default and orders that bond be forfeit 
recess: 11:17am

[MK] case called at 11:29am. 
Defendant Levi Allen Christian in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court continues the $300 Cash bond (already posted) , with no special conditions. 
recess 11:34am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/14/15 at 11:00am.    (2)  Status Conference on 11/10/15 at 10:30am.
Bond Payment Information
Surety Information
Bond Payment Information
Defendant posted bond at JCSD and was given a new court date/Duplicate original warrant returned by JCSD
May post $300 in lieu of arrest so long as the bond contains a new court date and time for the next court appearance.

[MK] case called at 2:55pm. 
Defendant Levi Allen Christian not in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
DA Happ indicates that the mailing of the Summons & Complaint was not returned to their office undelivered by the Postal Service. 
The Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause warrant-- to include the provision that Mr. Christian may post $300 in lieu of arrest so long as the Bond contains a new date and time for his court appearance.
recess 2:56pm.
